column4: Hey I am doing...    sudo bash ati-driver-installer-8.443.1-x86.x86_64.run --buildpkg Ubuntu/gutsy
but it says no such file
where should it be? what dir?
when you run a bash command with sudo ... where should the file be?
so when I run that command... and it says file not found what do I do?
I run this command right here  :sudo bash ati-driver-installer-8.443.1-x86.x86_64.run --buildpkg Ubuntu/gutsy
and it says file not found ... I am trying to install my drivers manually and following the tutorial...
you arent in the correct directory
little hint. You could have just typed "bash" and then drug the file you had on the desktop into the terminal
why do you want to manually install your card instead of using the auto installer?
you can drag and drop the file in your terminal
you can type whatever commands you want to run on it, then just drop the file in there
that just means that you dont have fglrx previously on there
